fermentables.name: Pilsen (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Light in colour and low in protein. Pilsen MD is made from the finest European two-row barley. This malt is well modified and can easily be mashed with a single temperature infusion. Due to the high enzymatic power it can be used up to 100% of the grain bill in all types of beer.

fermentables.name: Pale Ale (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Pale Ale malt is fully modified, kilned longer and more intensively. This malt gives your beer a golden colour.

fermentables.name: Munich (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Munich malt has a pronounced malty flavor, aroma and an orange-amber colour. It improves the character and full bodiness of the beer.

fermentables.name: Cara 20 (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Cara 20 MD is a very light crystal/caramel malt. The malt is produced in the drum. Due to the caramelisation and low drying temperatures its specific taste is achieved. Adding this type of malt increases the foam stability of your beers. Because of its light colour it can even be added in low percentages in your Pilsen beer to improve the foamstability.

fermentables.name: Aromatic Malt (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: The intensive germination and a mildly kilning will add a very strong malt aroma and a deep reddish colour. Amber malt clearly improves flavor stability.  The malt is rather low in diastatic power therefore it can only be used up to 30%.

fermentables.name: Biscuit (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: This toasted malt will provide a "warm bread" or biscuit flavour and aroma and will lend a garnet-brown colour. Biscuit MD is also produced in a roasting drum and has no enzymes, so it must be mashed with malts having high diastatic power.

fermentables.name: Cara 50 (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Cara 50 MD is a very light crystal/caramel malt used by a lot of Belgian breweries in producing Abbey beers. The malt is produced in the drum. Due to the  caramelisation and low drying temperatures its specific taste is achieved.

fermentables.name: Cara 120 (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Cara 120 MD is a darker caramel malt used by a lot of Belgian breweries in producing Abbey beers. The malt is produced in the drum. The malt will impart a rich caramel-sweet arome and full flavor, as well as intense dark color.

fermentables.name: Special B (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Special B MD's unique aroma and flavour is achieved through a unique double drying process. Special B MD imparts a heavy caramel taste and is often credited with the raisin-like flavor found in some Belgian Abbey beers. It can be used to substitute Chocolate or black malt when bitterness is not desired.

fermentables.name: Chocolate (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Mroost 900 MD is roasted at high temperatures and afterwards rapidly cooled when the desired color is achieved. Mroost 900 MD gives the beer a darker aroma and beer colour. Due to the unique production methods these roasted malts are less astringent.

fermentables.name: De-Bittered Black Malt (Dingemans)
fermentables.notes: Mroost 1400 MD is roasted at high temperature and afterwards rapidly cooled when the desired color is achieved. Mroost 1400 MD malt gives the beer a darker aroma and beer color, while also contributing a smoked/burnt flavour to dark beers. Due to the unique production methods these roasted malts are less astringent.
